result.execSummary:
The defendant James Edward Mayotte Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business tomorrow.
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: Undergo a Substance Abuse Assmt & comply with all treatment recommendations.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed! 
The defendant is ordered to random testing. 
Defendant is not to associate with any known drug users or those involved in trafficking, other than in a professional group counseling setting, meeting, or in a correctional setting.

Complete Moral Recognition Therapy as directed by the DOC. 
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days. 
Any contraband seized to be forfeited!

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Edward Mayotte Sr

records.addlTxt: 11:04 AM Defendant James Edward Mayotte Sr appeared by phone.  Attorney Thomas Locante appeared by video for James Edward Mayotte Sr.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF143,l 22CF49, and 22CF99.  PLQ and attachments filed this morning.  Def and Atty choosing option 2.  Parties have agreement.  State comments that there is no request for restitution.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court has reviewed victim impact statement.  Def is waiving right to personal appearance.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Def understands counts and range of potential penalties.  Atty def pleads GUILTY, def agrees.  Atty and def admit that he is a repeater.  Files contain PLQ, def understands information, rights giving up, and elements.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts GUILTY pleas.  As a factual basis can court rely on the information in the complaints, parties agree.  Court finds that a factual basis exists, finds def GUILTY and direct judgment to enter.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  See attached for sentencing.  Credit set at zero it is defense burden.
Email from Atty Locante re:  request to reschedule 11:00 hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:05 PM Defendant James Edward Mayotte Sr appeared by phone.  Attorney Thomas Locante appeared by video for James Edward Mayotte Sr.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF143, 22CF49, and 22CF99.  Atty, have a resolution asking for plea/sent date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

8:33 AM Defendant James Edward Mayotte Sr appeared by phone.  Attorney Thomas Locante appeared by video for James Edward Mayotte Sr.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF143, 22CF49, and 22CF99.  22CF99 here for preliminary hearing, attorney asking for a waiver.  Def is waiving right for a preliminary hearing, understands rights, understands giving those rights up.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied def is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waiving right to preliminary hearing, courts accepts waiver.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, case bound over for arraignment, state filing information now.  Attorney arraignment now, reviewed charges, and maximum penalties, waiving reading of information, stands mute, entering NG pleas.  Global offer provided yesterday from State.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:33 PM Defendant James Edward Mayotte Sr appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Locante appeared by video for James Edward Mayotte Sr.  Attorney Lynne Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF99, 21CF143, and 22CF49. 
 22CF99 is initial appearance.  Atty received compliant, waives reading.  State requests $100 cash, conditions, not possess or use any electronic cards that are not in his name.  Atty comments bail/bond asking for signature bond.  On cash bail in other cases.  Court orders $5000 signature bond, not possess or use any electronic cards that are not in his name.  
Other cases track along.
Can zoom, has to be stipulation appearing by video, absent that needs to appear in person.  Def needs to sign bond, can come by close of business tomorrow, at COC office.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

02:25 PM Defendant James Edward Mayotte in court with attorney Thomas Locante.  Ruth kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today.  22CF49,21CF143-- Atty comments on the cases, new charge coming down. Atty would like another STC. State comments on schd. Rec'd a new referral on Friday, State will be filing new charges, would like to resolve all the cases. In 9 days 21cf143 will be a year old, the Ct will give another STC, but the cases are at the end of the courts rope. If no agreement at the next hearing the Ct will set trial dates on the older cases.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on June 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

03:16 PM Defendant James Edward Mayotte in court with attorney Thomas Locante.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today.  21CF143,22CF49-- 21CF143, STC and 22cf49 is set for a prelim. Atty comments- def will waive right to a prelim. 
  Ct finds know and vol waives right to prelim. Ct finds PC the def com a fel in Ashland Co & bound over for argnmt. State has filed an info now, atty has a copy. PLEADS NG, noted.  Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:21 AM - 21 CF 143, 22 CF 49 - Attorney Thomas Locante appeared by video means for Defendant James Edward Mayotte. Prosecuting Atty David V. Meany appeared for State of Wisconsin via video. Defendant James Edward Mayotte in court.  COVID - ZOOM; 22 CF 49} INIT - rec'd copy of compl, waives read, req PH set.  22 CF 49 PH, other case track along, parties may ZOOM next dte.  Stip/or video for PH though.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
